repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Python 3.11 alpha 4 removed exc_type and exc_traceback fields the the
_PyErr_StackItem structure:

* https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/396b58345f81d4c8c5a52546d2288e666a1b9b8b
* https://bugs.python.org/issue45711
* https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4500

comment_data.body: The naming convention is to use double underscores for internal variants of "regular" helper functions, e.g. after handling special cases in an inline function. These functions should just have a single underscore as name separator.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -482,17 +501,52 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE void __Pyx__ExceptionReset(PyThreadState *tstate, PyObject
 #define __Pyx_ExceptionReset(type, value, tb)  PyErr_SetExcInfo(type, value, tb)
 #endif
 
+/////////////// _ExceptionGetType.proto ///////////////
+
+static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject* __Pyx__ExceptionGetType(PyObject *value) {

comment_data.body: I think this needs a cast in C++
And this needs to be defined on Python 3.4+ only. On C++ the lack of declaration for `PyException_GetTraceback` is causing it to fail

commit.message:
Support Python 3.11a4 _PyErr_StackItem

Python 3.11 alpha 4 removed exc_type and exc_traceback fields the the
_PyErr_StackItem structure:

* https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/396b58345f81d4c8c5a52546d2288e666a1b9b8b
* https://bugs.python.org/issue45711
* https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4500

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

title: Support Python 3.11a4 _PyErr_StackItem
